content.raw:
Should put the encoding string in a constant. Something like \`GENOMEDATA\_NAME\_ENCODING\`. This should be done for all instances of “latin-1”.

It’s probably also worth commenting on the choice of “latin-1” \(or ISO 8859-1\) in this case. It makes sense but it might be worth mentioning it’s the 8-bit extension on top of ascii \(7-bit\) \(which was natively used before\).
content.html:
Should put the encoding string in a constant. Something like `GENOMEDATA_NAME_ENCODING`. This should be done for all instances of “latin-1”.

It’s probably also worth commenting on the choice of “latin-1” (or ISO 8859-1) in this case. It makes sense but it might be worth mentioning it’s the 8-bit extension on top of ascii (7-bit) (which was natively used before).
